lines.content: Welcome to the **Angel Chatbot** project! This chatbot is designed to help you manage your tasks with ease. It supports various commands to add, mark, and delete tasks, making your life more organized.
- Easily mark tasks as done or undone.
- Saves tasks automatically to a file for persistence.
- User-friendly command parsing with detailed feedback.
> "Great things are not done by impulse, but by a series of small things brought together." â€” Vincent Van Gogh
If you are a Java Programmer you can use it to practice code too. Heres the 'main' method:
* Handles user commands, task management, and data persistence.

* Constructs an Angel instance and initializes the task list.
* Loads tasks from the storage file if it exists.
* Continuously reads user input, processes commands, and updates task list.
ui.print("Hello! I'm Angel\nWhat can I do for you?");
ui.print("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
ui.print("Got it. I've added this task:\n  " + todoDescription);
ui.print("Got it. I've added this task:\n  " + deadlineDetail.getDescription() + " by: " + deadlineDetail.getDeadline().format(INPUT_FORMAT));
ui.print("Got it. I've added this task:\n  " + eventDetail.getDescription() + " from: " + eventDetail.getFrom().format(INPUT_FORMAT) + " to: " + eventDetail.getTo().format(INPUT_FORMAT));
ui.print("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n  " + taskList.listTasks().get(markIndex));
ui.print("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:\n  " + taskList.listTasks().get(unmarkIndex));
ui.print("Noted. I've removed this task:\n  " + taskList.listTasks().get(deleteIndex));
List<Task> foundTasks = taskList.findTasks(keyword); // Correct type is List<Task>
ui.print("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
ui.printFoundTasks(foundTasks); // You need a method to print the list of tasks
throw new InvalidCommandException("Unknown command: " + command.getType() + ". Please enter a valid command.");
ui.printError(e.getMessage() + " Please check the task number and try again.");

* Parses the command for creating a deadline task.

* @return A Command object for the deadline task.
* @throws InvalidCommandException If the deadline description or date/time is missing or incorrectly formatted.

return new Command("deadline", new DeadlineDetail(deadlineDetails[0], deadlineDate));

throw new InvalidCommandException("The description of an event must include '/from' and '/to' followed by the start and end times. Example: 'event project meeting /from 2019-10-10 1800 /to 2019-10-10 2000'.");
return new Command("event", new EventDetail(eventDetails[0], fromDate, toDate));

* Constructs a new ToDo task with the specified description.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Returns a string representation of the ToDo task.
* The string format is "[T][status icon] description", where:
* - [status icon] is either "X" if the task is marked as done or " " if not.
* - description is the description of the task.
* @return A string representing the ToDo task.
* Returns the task in a format suitable for saving to a file.
* The format is "T | isDone | description", where:
* - isDone is "1" if the task is completed, otherwise "0".
* - description is the description of the task.
* @return A string representing the ToDo task in save format.

* Tests the creation of a Deadline instance with a valid description and due date/time.
// Create a Deadline task with a valid description and date/time
Deadline deadline = new Deadline("Submit assignment", dueDate);
// Assert that the Deadline task is created correctly
assertNotNull(deadline, "The deadline should not be null");
"The string representation of the deadline is incorrect");
* Tests the string representation of a Deadline instance.

Deadline deadline = new Deadline("Complete project", dueDate);
// Assert that the string representation matches the expected format
"The string representation of the deadline is incorrect");
* Tests the save format of a Deadline instance.
// Test the save format of the Deadline task
Deadline deadline = new Deadline("Submit assignment", dueDate);
// Assert that the save format is correctly encoded
"The save format of the deadline is incorrect");
* Tests handling of a Deadline instance with a null due date.
// Test creating a Deadline with a null due date (should throw an exception)
"Creating a deadline with a null due date should throw a NullPointerException");
* Test class for the Event class.
* Tests the creation of an Event instance with valid description, start, and end date/time.
Event event = new Event("Project meeting", from, to);
assertNotNull(event, "The event should not be null");
assertEquals("[E][ ] Project meeting (from: Oct 15 2024, 1400, to: Oct 15 2024, 1600)", event.toString(),
"The string representation of the event is incorrect");
* Tests the save format of an Event instance.
Event event = new Event("Project meeting", from, to);
"The save format of the event is incorrect");
* Tests creating an Event with invalid date or time inputs (null values).
// Test case for invalid date or time input (null values).
assertThrows(NullPointerException.class, () -> new Event("Invalid event", null, null),
"Creating an event with null date/time should throw a NullPointerException");
* Tests marking an Event as done.
Event event = new Event("Team meeting", from, to);
assertEquals("[E][X] Team meeting (from: Oct 15 2024, 1400, to: Oct 15 2024, 1600)", event.toString(),
"The string representation of the event after marking as done is incorrect");
